author: Deborah Gage
title: Software for the Blue-Collar Workforce
text:
Business software companies are turning their attention to the blue-collar workforce.
For years, the software industry focused on what it calls knowledge workers, cranking out spreadsheets, word processors, presentation software and communications tools for those who work in offices. Now, software developers and entrepreneurs are paying closer attention to those who don’t work at desks (there are 113 million such workers, according to an estimate from investment firm Battery Ventures)—specifically plumbers, contractors, garage-door...
